page.title: 18WILDLIFE ON THE NENE
page.content:
If you wander down the banks of the river Nene you will see a variety of wildlife. In the river there is a host of different fish, pike, perch, roach, eels, bream and tench. The bird life includes swans, moorhens, coots, mallards and herons. Frogs also spawn there.
Pollution does not seem to be a serious problem here, although some anglers have been criticised by conservationists and local wildlife wardens for using lead weights and leaving fishing line in the river. There is also some concern about the effect of pesticides on fish and birds. Rubbish from holiday boats on the river and the possible effect of acid rain on the local forests have also been mentioned as hazards.
